content: top down no swatch hat designed by melissa friedlund yarn any needle whatever you need for the fabric you want notions stitch markers yarn needle pattern co 8 divide sts in half for magic looping and join in the round round 1 k8 mark the beginning of the round round 2 *k1 m1 place marker repeat from * until 16sts do not worry about a placing a marker b/w the 4th and 5th sections or b/w the 8th and 1st sections this is where the break is b/w the two halves of the sts is count each break as a marker round 3 and all odd rounds until increases are finished knit around round 4 *k to marker m1 repeat till end of round slipping markers as you go repeat round 3 & 4 until you have enough sts for the circumference of the hat to figure out the number of sts you need measure your gauge after several rounds lets say 10 then multiply your spi stitches per inch by the desired circumference of the hat let s say you are getting 5spi and you want a 20 hat that s 5 x 20 = 100 sts you will only have multiples of 8 as your stitch count so the closest are 96 or 104 decide if you want it over-sized or snug & keep increasing till you re there then knit stockinette stitch for 3 next knit 2x2 ribbing for 4 bobble knitwise as follows *bobble 3 sts then k2tog & bobble this stitch repeat from * till the end finishing thread the cast on tail through a yarn needle & work it around the cast on edge & pull tight secure & weave in ends you can customize this any way you want if you don t want a flip-up brim but are still ending it with a ribbed edge then switch the bind off directions to binding off purlwise and using p2tog instead of k2tog page 1 of 1 for personal use only not to be reprinted without permission © melissa friedlund 1/10/12
